Managing Gradle Dependencies

19 Oct 2015

Lately, I'm wondering how can I make my gradle build files better. Then I found a way to manage my gradle dependencies version separately from project gradle files that will be really helpful if you separate your project into several parts, for example MVP design pattern.

To achieve this you need to create a new gradle file, in my case I will name it dependencies and I will put it in buildconfig folder.

And manage your dependencies in that file

 1 allprojects {
 2   repositories {
 3     jcenter()
 4   }
 5 }
 6 
 7 ext {
 8   //Libraries
 9   androidSupportLibraryVersion = '23.0.1'
10   butterKnifeVersion = '7.0.1'
11   rxJavaVersion = '1.0.14'
12   rxAndroidVersion = '1.0.1'
13 
14   //Test
15   espressoVersion = '2.2.1'
16   androidTestSupportLibraryVersion = '0.1'
17 
18   uiDependencies = [
19       androidSupportLibraryV4:     "com.android.support:support-v4:${androidSupportLibraryVersion}",
20       androidSupportAppcompatV7:   "com.android.support:appcompat-v7:${androidSupportLibraryVersion}",
21       recyclerView:                "com.android.support:recyclerview-v7:${androidSupportLibraryVersion}",
22       androidSupportDesign:        "com.android.support:design:${androidSupportLibraryVersion}",
23       butterKnife:                 "com.jakewharton:butterknife:${butterKnifeVersion}",
24       rxJava:                      "io.reactivex:rxjava:${rxJavaVersion}",
25       rxAndroid:                   "io.reactivex:rxandroid:${rxAndroidVersion}",
26   ]
27 
28   uiTestDependencies = [
29       espresso:                    "com.android.support.test.espresso:espresso-core:${espressoVersion}",
30       androidTestRunner:           "com.android.support.test:runner:${androidTestSupportLibraryVersion}",
31       androidTestRules:            "com.android.support.test:rules:${androidTestSupportLibraryVersion}",
32   ]
33 }

And then to integrate this to your build files you need to include this line to your build.gradle file (The top level one, not the project build gradle)

apply from: 'buildconfig/dependencies.gradle'

And then you can use it in your project build gradle like this

 1 dependencies {
 2   def uiDependencies = rootProject.ext.uiDependencies
 3   def uiTestDependencies = rootProject.ext.uiTestDependencies
 4 
 5   compile uiDependencies.androidSupportLibraryV4
 6   compile uiDependencies.androidSupportAppcompatV7
 7   compile uiDependencies.recyclerView
 8   compile uiDependencies.androidSupportDesign
 9   compile uiDependencies.butterKnife
10   compile uiDependencies.rxJava
11   compile uiDependencies.rxAndroid
12 
13   compile uiTestDependencies.espresso
14   compile uiTestDependencies.androidTestRunner
15   compile uiTestDependencies.androidTestRules
16 }

That's all, I hope my post can help you! If you have any question, send me a tweet or leave a comment below! If you like this post you can share it with your friends using share buttons below.
